advice: Get plenty of rest. Drink lots of fluids. Use saline nasal sprays. Gargle with salt water for sore throat.
If symptoms worsen, last more than 10 days, or you develop a high fever, consult a doctor.
Rest, fluids, and over-the-counter flu medications can help manage symptoms.
Seek immediate medical attention if you experience difficulty breathing, chest pain, sudden dizziness, or severe vomiting.
Increase sun exposure safely. Incorporate Vitamin D rich foods like fatty fish, fortified milk, and cereals.
Consult a doctor for a proper diagnosis and to discuss Vitamin D supplementation, as dosage varies based on severity.
